Great Phone, Absolutely Stupid Design
I have been using computers since the 70s when I was in college and purchased my first IBM clone in 1992, and was using PDAs very early on
I had one of the first Windows smart phones but got rid of it in favor of a flip phone
I never jumped on the iPhone bandwagon either
I had read that a lot of smartphone addict aficionados look for the latest and greatest
or maybe they did not like the color of their new phone
so they sent it back

Rather than winding up in landfills as a lot of returned Amazon merchandise does, unfortunately, Amazon was wise enough to create their refurbished division in which various refurbishers compete for customer's business
I thought, why not give it a try
I purchased the phone from a company named Kiss in Manhattan where I grew up
They had a high positive rating so I picked themMy phone arrived the next day despite the fact that I did not pay for overnight shipping
As for the phone, when I opened up the box, I was shocked
In terms of appearance, there was absolutely no way I would have known it was a refurb
not a mark on it
As far as function is concerned, I used various apps to test it, and it passed
I have been using it since the first week of August
My estimate of battery life remaining is upwards of 90 percent
Of note, at Batteries and Bulbs, I can replace the battery for something like 70 dollars still putting me way ahead of the game since the phone was under 400 dollars
Add a Microcenter 512 MicroSD card for about 50 dollars and I have a phone with 3/4 of a terabyte, far more storage than I anticipate ever using
As such, it would look very nice put upon a pedestal in our living room
I purchased it to use every day as my mobile phone
What is the Note 9 made of?Simply put, it is basically glass placed over a metal frame which again is fine if you want to display it on your bookshelf, but not particularly practical
Unless a person is downright foolish, just about everyone puts a case on it
You can forget about using one of those clear cases that let the beauty of the phone shine through
Drop it and you are facing an expensive repair
I was using the Unicorn Beetle Pro case with a belt clip which I never used
The phone dropped on the stairs and the inner part of the case broke
I was not really upset about that for the simple reason it saved the phone
Now I am trying an Outbox Defender which looks pretty robust
How about the curved display?Yes, it looks rather elegant, but does one really need it for functionality?The answer is absolutely not
It only serves to make designing a screen protector problematic
As for screen protectors go, I think they are necessary and I have just resigned myself to the fact that the edge adhesives are going to wear out and to simply replace them every once and awhile
They are not particularly expensive
We as consumers really should not put up with this nonsense
Most of the smartphones made these days have similar designs
They reinforce the notion of built-in obsolescence, or in actuality, built-in fragility
There is absolutely no reason that we should have to get a new phone every year
They should last far longer than that in my humble opinion
The question is how can we communicate this to the manufacturers?We can't boycott them because they all pretty much do the same thing
just saying

Went from Note 5 to Note 9 with no regrets.
I loved my Note 5 but after the Note 10 came out, I realized the 5 was starting to show its age

To be sure, I could replace the battery and probably get a couple more decent years out of the 5 but it wasn't getting any more Android updates and I could tell it was getting a little slower to launch apps
However I didn't want to spend upwards of a $1,000 on the shiny new Note 10
It didn't help that my wife had already upgraded her Note 5 to an 8
So after some soul searching and web searching for a good priced, gently used Note 9, I decided on this one
So far it's amazing!The battery life is easily double that of the 5 and apps snap open
The only thing I miss so far is the Flipboard/Briefing that was available on the 5 by swiping right
Instead there's Bixby now, but maybe I just need to customize and get used to it
The Note 9 itself arrived in near new condition
The screen is crystal clear with no scuffs or scratches, the back has a slight scuff which disappears when I put the clear case/cover on

Be aware that renewed Note 9 listings aren’t ‘new’ or 'like new' condition

The N960U Samsung Galaxy Note 9 is still a powerful phone with a great screen (if you get get a good enough protector on there - I recommend dispersion glue UV cure ones like Whitestone), but beware these Renewed category items - you are basically buying a used phone like any other, with scratches, burn-in and any number of other issues

95 for a 512GB Note 9 (Blue), a high used market price - because they listed it as 'Condition: NEW' yet it came with scratches on the back - with a dirty white generic box and sans the OEM accessories like AKG earbuds

Speaking of software, the phone came with android 9 Pie OS preinstalled, as well as the usual Samsung bloatware, but that's it
The package contained the phone (Snapdragon 845 version), charged to half capacity, a Samsung's charger and a noname USB type C cord
Not a deal breaker for sure, just a minor annoyance
Everything the phone is supposed to be doing it is doing with gusto
The only thing I really miss is the IR blaster, which was present on some earlier Notes

Phone marked as "stolen" in Verizon's database - can't be activated
I purchased the Verizon unlocked version of this phone
They sent me the fully factory unlocked version of the phone
I thought this wasn't a problem - should be able to swap my sim card
My sim card was the wrong size, so I took the phone to Verizon to get a new sim, and they said they couldn't activate the new phone because it was marked as stolen in their database
They confirmed that the phone was unlocked and COULD be activated by Verizon if it weren't marked as stolen
I know it's a gamble purchasing refurbished items, but I didn't expect an Amazon certified seller and refurbisher to be selling stolen phones
That's why I shop on Amazon rather than eBay
Good think Amazon backs this with their return policy
I'll be getting a refund

I love everything about this phone except the fact that the microphone doesn't work
Everything else about the phone is fantastic, but if you want to talk on the phone, record sound, use text to speak features or anything of that nature, the microphone is so low you won't be able to
These features work fine if you have a headset or if you're using Bluetooth for phone calls, but it's irritating

It's also such a large phone that you really need something to carry it in

WOW - Amazon Refurb is the way to go!  Just 1 small gripe (charger cable)
I was a little sketched out buying a used phone but figured it was worth a shot since Amazon warrantees your purchase for 90 days AND they're guaranteed to look like new
All I can say is WOW - mine very much did look brand new and I absolutely cannot tell it apart from a factory sealed phone fresh out of the box
In fact, still had the plastic on the front screen and bezels - maybe this is something this particular seller provides but I was surprised
It was factory unlocked as promised
All I needed to do was install my VZW SIM and a spare 128GB micro-SD I had lying around and power it on
It was connected, up and running in under 5 minutes
Battery is 95% healthy according to the Ampere app, stylus works perfect and I couldn't be happier minus one caveat - the charger
It's clearly called out in the listing that 'it may not include the original charger' but the charger I received does not really work
It doesn't fast charge at all - mainly because the USB-USBC cable is junk
The wall plug itself is ok (Qualcomm PD 3
I ended up buying a set of USBC fast charger cables + a wireless fast charger w/next day shipping, so it wasn't a big deal
Oh well - minus one star on that but the PHONE ITSELF and the Refurb program both get a full 5

What's not to like?
Easy set up
Bixby Fail
Rating is for the phone itself, not the condition
I even got the OEM charger included in my box
The biggest problem? The most frustrating thing I have every experienced with a phone? Especially on a phone that costs this much?The Bixby button
The physical button on the side, in the middle
After you hit it by mistake Bixby will take over and what you were doing is gone, poof
So normally if you hit the volume key by mistake (which is less likely since it's higher) then no big deal if your volume goes up or down 2 percent from one wrong tap
Hit the Bixby button by mistake and it opens itself full screen and no matter what you were in the middle of is taken away
Samsung will not let you uninstall Bixby
And if you double tap (thinking you are changing the volume) it will STILL open Bixby full screen regardless of what you remapped to
Since I can't set it to do nothing - whatever app you remapped to takes over and the screen you were on is gone
I've got to where I don't ever do anything in landscape mode because I know as soon as I rotate the phone in my hand I'm going to touch it by mistake
Some of my other complaints I think are Android Pie's fault so I won't mention those
The camera software I hate, it's constantly changing the brightness even though the lights in the room I'm in are staying the same

So the physical camera may be better than was in my old Note 4, the software makes it aggravating, even the editing software for pictures is worse than my Note 4, but this costs double what my Note 4 did
The speaker on bottom instead of on back or front firing means it gets muffled if you hold in on your chest in bed or place it on a charging stand
The headphone jack on the bottom means I have to hold phone upside down so the jack doesn't get in the way/bent over
Good things? It is fast, responsive, battery life is good (so long as you are not playing a game)
I saw in the news the new Galaxy Fold for $2000 also has a Bixby button
You pay this much for a phone it would be nice if you get to decide how you want to use it and what apps you want to use

I think potential buyers should note, however, that the product description CLEARLY states that the phone will not work on Sprint, Verizon, Boost, Virgin Mobile or any other CDMA network, so a lot of these negative reviews are from people who didn't take the time to read the product specs
The two issues that I had with this phone were that cosmetically it's advertised as being in near perfect condition and mine had a few major gauges on it
The other issue was that while I understood that I would not be receiving any manuals or original packaging, it was supposed to come with a certified cable, which was definitely was not the case
Not a bad value for the price, but if you buy something refurbished, I guess the lesson is to keep cosmetic expectations on the lower end of the spectrum, and expect a few hiccups

Having been heavily involved in the mobile phone repair, refurbishing and reverse logistics business for a few years, a few years back, I expected more from an Amazon certified renewed product and seller
I received the Note 9 today after a 5 day shipping time (thats with PRIME)

First off, the phone is in a bubble bag, inside a generic white box, with NO spacer or even bubble wrap to hold the phone handset from flopping around inside the box that is at least 4 inches longer than the phone and the generic Ashley charger and cable were all moving around as well
The battery was at 1% when I turned it on, and the phone had to be charged before I could set it up
The back of the handset has significant scratches on the lower edge (see photos), and there was a cheap glass screen saver attached to the front of handset
which I quickly discovered interfered greatly in the touch screen operation on the right side
I tested all functionality with Samsung's internal 'secret code' test mode and all checked OK, though the S pen seemed to hang up a bit
I will test the handset fully tomorrow with SIM card on a T-Mobile MVNO network

Assuming it all tests well, I will keep the phone, but think at this price at least the 'renewed' (we used to call it refurbished) wouldn't be scratched and original accessories would be included, and that the seller would at least charge the handset before shipping
and think about protecting it in the box for transit

Great Phone with a Known Software/Firmware Issue
When I initially received my phone, it came in the original box and it was working perfectly

After doing some investigation, it turns out that there is a known firmware/software issue with the Samsung Galaxy Note 9 where the fingerprint scanner gets moisture inside of it and the phone tries to recalibrate the scanner by restarting
After some trial and error I got my Samsung Galaxy Note 9 to stop restarting by not allowing the fingerprint scanner to be used to unlock my phone
I can still use my fingerprint to unlock apps, but not even hard restarting allows for me to use my fingerprint scanner to unlock my phone
Everything else on this phone works wonderfully and I would recommend it to anyone, so long as they are happy using iris scanner instead of the fingerprint scanner to unlock their phone

I have always bought my Samsung Notes new but when my Note 8's is camera broke it was time to look into an upgrade
The Note 9 however has always appealed to me as the last great Note series with even better battery life than the newer Notes
It was selling at a good price for a renewed version on Amazon so I took a leap of faith and bought one
I say a leap of faith because one I had never bought used and two I had heard horror stories and read horrible reviews about people who had such bad experiences buying renewed phone
I was a bit skeptical to say the least but I bought the Note 9 anyway and I can honestly say I could not be happier with its condition and how quickly it was delivered
I even received an actual Samsung charger with it which many people in their reviews complained the seller would send some cheap knock off charger instead
Maybe I'm one of the lucky ones and only time will tell if the battery lasts and everything keeps working as great as it is now but for now I am thrilled with my decision to buy the phone

Good phone if you like Microsoft
The battery really lasted long, especially since I turned off all the unnecessary apps and did not keep data connected when I didn't need to
The screen is big and clear and pleasant to work with
The images flip sideways when you turn the phone
One Note, a quick note taking program, requires signing up with a username that stores your notes in a cloud and not on the phone
You can pin each note to the start page, but otherwise, you must store it off the phone
There is no delete button and you must use the Back/Left arrow to backtrack, leaving all your paths to be retraced
My biggest beef, however, is that I need browser flexibility which the phone does not have
I need to link quickly from emails to a work website, but the Internet Explorer browser on the phone requires that I sign in with a password on that website every time I link to it
Explorer can be bypassed for other internet browsing, if you download another one that Windows phones will take (not Opera mini), but emails still must use Explorer, so that doesn't help me
Just be prepared when you buy such a phone that you will have to love being a Microsoft and Windows patron

Which leads to #77) When you use the multi-window options and swipe to close the app, it doesn't always close the app

After a couple taps of the multi-window key, you'll find that it went into the floating window view
see #68)Back to video playing/streaming

Decent Phone, But TCL Not Making Promised Updates
I have had to carry a cell phone for work for some years now and didn't want to deal with it and my own every time I went out the door, but transitioning jobs I found I needed my own
We have always favored unlocked phones to be able to provide our own a la carte provider so the TCL 10L seemed like a good option
Clear picture, a battery that lasts all day without any problem even at our house with in and out cell tower range, and the TCL customized Android interface that works well

It's similar to stock with some minor improvements and you can adjust the changes back to normal if desired, one example being the lock screen where I prefer the full notifications vs their icon based view
It is a large screen that's bright and easy to read and I use it every day
Playing a few heavier processor mobile games has had no problems
My major complaint is that TCL has not fulfilled their promises at all regarding software updates to the phone
The company publicly stated that the 10L and 10 Pro would both receive at least one upgrade in Android version from 10 to 11, and security updates every 2 months for at least 2 years
To date, they did update to Android 11 in March, but failed to provide any security updates since until they finally released one in Oct 2021

This is nowhere near the promised releases and a major failing from the company in keeping their promises, and is glaring in light of the Android One program being embraced to offer 2 years of Android OS updates and 3 years of security patches by many competing vendors
This fact alone has encouraged me to look elsewhere when I ultimately replace this in the future and make me question their long term support for the device and why I would support such a vendor

This is my first non-Verizon purchased phone and I was worried, but that was mostly FUD
I am also back to playing Pokemon Go and Harry Potter Wizards Unite after a few month hiatus since this phone is fast enough to play them comfortably
Sorry for the length; thanks for reading, and enjoy!
Just an FYI for NFC users
I really like everything about this phone, however:While trying to set up the phone's NFC for a device I use frequently, I could not get the device's app to read it's NFC device
They convinced me the issue was not the phone's NFC, but the Android app I was trying to use with it
I was not the first person having problems with some apps that use NFC
After much going back & forth with the app developer, they admitted very few phones with NFC work with their app
In fact the newest phone that did, is 4 years old
I've seen many comments that it works fine with Google Pay
If you don't require NFC, then I highly recommend the TCL 10L

Pros-The display is big and bright enough, with rich colors and decent viewing angles
-Performance is solid
-Battery life is more than enough for a day of moderate use
-Programmable smart key includes a lot of pre-built options, but you can't add more
-Fingerprint reader on back is good
-Useful gestures like double tap to turn on the screen
Cons-Video playback with lots of fast movement is occasionally choppy
-Photos and videos are just okay for casual sharing, on par with other budget Android phones
-I miss Moto Display, where the screen lights up and shows notifications when I take my phone out of my pocket or pick it up from a table

Phone GPS not working
I have TCL 10L , purchased in 2021
Defective GPS phone
If it weren't for the defective GPS in the phone, I'd give this phone 4
5 stars, but instead it gets 2 stars
I loved the price, 256 gb of storage, 6 g of ram so it ran fast, long battery life with a quick charge, and it took nice pictures
The phone was slim with a large screen and narrow enough I could hold it in my small hands
The phone could never locate my location and constantly jumped around even when the phone was stationary
Sometimes it was 500 ft off, other times, more than a mile off, but it was never where I actually was and it constantly bounced to random locations
No amount of calibrating the compass, running updates, deleting google maps, restarting the phone, making sure location accuracy was on, etc would work
When running google maps or Waze, it would constantly reroute and tell you to turn around, or turn left, turn right, etc because it couldn't figure out where the phone was
Don't even get me started on city driving
I called amazon and they sent me a replacement so I could return the first one
I set up the new one hoping that the first one was just a lemon, but the second TCL 10L was exactly the same
Everything else worked great, but again, the GPS would not work
My friend who also bought the same phone around Christmas time has the same problem so she also got a replacement sent to her by Amazon
Her second phone also had a defective GPS, so between the 2 of us, we are 0 for 4
I finally gave up and returned the phone and had to buy at different phone altogether

Not sure if all these phones came from the same defective batch or what, but I am very disappointed because I really liked the phone and its specs, which were higher than the new phone I have now that cost me more
Just to note, I don't think all TCL phones are bad
I bought 2 of my kids the lower TCL 10SE version for Christmas and theirs work perfectly fine and the GPS has no problems

You Won't Be Disappointed with this Phone
If you are looking for a phone under $300, this is going to be hard to beat

I did catch mine on sale for $212, but I had already decided on this phone when it was still $249, and it is worth every bit of that price had I not been lucky enough for it to go on sale the day after it made it to the top of the list of under-$300 phones I'd been researching
Even though this has a cheaper screen compared to the 10 Pro, the display is bright, crisp, and colorful
Reviewers bash the phone for having a mono speaker, but it sounds good enough
It doesn't bother me not being stereo, and for serious listening I pair my Bluetooth earbuds anyway
I love the camera
In daylight, the photos are beautiful
The camera does a wonderful job in portrait mode
In good lighting, my wife's iPhone has nothing over this camera, and in some cases does not perform as well
Colors are slightly over saturated, but not at all to a point where pictures look over-processed or unnatural
In low light, you no longer rival the cameras of more expensive phones
You get three actions to set
Battery life is really good, but was just average out of the box
I'm running the Microsoft Launcher and have an animated wallpaper, but do keep in mind I don't have Facebook and Google assistant and others running in the background either
The phone comes with a screen protector already installed, which is a nice touch
You also get a soft case that won't do much for protecting against a drop but will protect the case from scratches and bumps
Some people are turned off by the TCL logo on the back, but it doesn't bother me
Overall impression is that this is a great phone for a really, really good price
This has been my first experience with an affordable Android phone that wasn't limited to tolerable
Android 10 runs really smooth, and the device just has a nice overall physical feel to it
If you want a really good phone but don't like spending a lot, this is one of the best you will find in the $200-300 price range

Decent Phone, But TCL Not Making Promised Updates
I have had to carry a cell phone for work for some years now and didn't want to deal with it and my own every time I went out the door, but transitioning jobs I found I needed my own
We have always favored unlocked phones to be able to provide our own a la carte provider so the TCL 10L seemed like a good option
Clear picture, a battery that lasts all day without any problem even at our house with in and out cell tower range, and the TCL customized Android interface that works well

It's similar to stock with some minor improvements and you can adjust the changes back to normal if desired, one example being the lock screen where I prefer the full notifications vs their icon based view
It is a large screen that's bright and easy to read and I use it every day
Playing a few heavier processor mobile games has had no problems
My major complaint is that TCL has not fulfilled their promises at all regarding software updates to the phone
The company publicly stated that the 10L and 10 Pro would both receive at least one upgrade in Android version from 10 to 11, and security updates every 2 months for at least 2 years
To date, they did update to Android 11 in March, but failed to provide any security updates since until they finally released one in Oct 2021

This is nowhere near the promised releases and a major failing from the company in keeping their promises, and is glaring in light of the Android One program being embraced to offer 2 years of Android OS updates and 3 years of security patches by many competing vendors
This fact alone has encouraged me to look elsewhere when I ultimately replace this in the future and make me question their long term support for the device and why I would support such a vendor

Just an FYI for NFC users
I really like everything about this phone, however:While trying to set up the phone's NFC for a device I use frequently, I could not get the device's app to read it's NFC device
They convinced me the issue was not the phone's NFC, but the Android app I was trying to use with it
I was not the first person having problems with some apps that use NFC
After much going back & forth with the app developer, they admitted very few phones with NFC work with their app
In fact the newest phone that did, is 4 years old
I've seen many comments that it works fine with Google Pay
If you don't require NFC, then I highly recommend the TCL 10L

-Fingerprint reader on back is good

-I miss Moto Display, where the screen lights up and shows notifications when I take my phone out of my pocket or pick it up from a table

I'm writing this review almost a year to the day of purchasing the phone in 2021
Phone GPS not working
I have TCL 10L , purchased in 2021
Defective GPS phone
If it weren't for the defective GPS in the phone, I'd give this phone 4
5 stars, but instead it gets 2 stars
I loved the price, 256 gb of storage, 6 g of ram so it ran fast, long battery life with a quick charge, and it took nice pictures
The phone was slim with a large screen and narrow enough I could hold it in my small hands
The phone could never locate my location and constantly jumped around even when the phone was stationary
Sometimes it was 500 ft off, other times, more than a mile off, but it was never where I actually was and it constantly bounced to random locations
No amount of calibrating the compass, running updates, deleting google maps, restarting the phone, making sure location accuracy was on, etc would work
When running google maps or Waze, it would constantly reroute and tell you to turn around, or turn left, turn right, etc because it couldn't figure out where the phone was
Don't even get me started on city driving
I called amazon and they sent me a replacement so I could return the first one
I set up the new one hoping that the first one was just a lemon, but the second TCL 10L was exactly the same
Everything else worked great, but again, the GPS would not work
My friend who also bought the same phone around Christmas time has the same problem so she also got a replacement sent to her by Amazon
Her second phone also had a defective GPS, so between the 2 of us, we are 0 for 4
I finally gave up and returned the phone and had to buy at different phone altogether

Not sure if all these phones came from the same defective batch or what, but I am very disappointed because I really liked the phone and its specs, which were higher than the new phone I have now that cost me more
Just to note, I don't think all TCL phones are bad
I bought 2 of my kids the lower TCL 10SE version for Christmas and theirs work perfectly fine and the GPS has no problems

You Won't Be Disappointed with this Phone
If you are looking for a phone under $300, this is going to be hard to beat

I did catch mine on sale for $212, but I had already decided on this phone when it was still $249, and it is worth every bit of that price had I not been lucky enough for it to go on sale the day after it made it to the top of the list of under-$300 phones I'd been researching
Even though this has a cheaper screen compared to the 10 Pro, the display is bright, crisp, and colorful
Reviewers bash the phone for having a mono speaker, but it sounds good enough
It doesn't bother me not being stereo, and for serious listening I pair my Bluetooth earbuds anyway
I love the camera
In daylight, the photos are beautiful
The camera does a wonderful job in portrait mode
In good lighting, my wife's iPhone has nothing over this camera, and in some cases does not perform as well
Colors are slightly over saturated, but not at all to a point where pictures look over-processed or unnatural
In low light, you no longer rival the cameras of more expensive phones
You get three actions to set
Battery life is really good, but was just average out of the box
I'm running the Microsoft Launcher and have an animated wallpaper, but do keep in mind I don't have Facebook and Google assistant and others running in the background either
The phone comes with a screen protector already installed, which is a nice touch
You also get a soft case that won't do much for protecting against a drop but will protect the case from scratches and bumps
Some people are turned off by the TCL logo on the back, but it doesn't bother me
Overall impression is that this is a great phone for a really, really good price
This has been my first experience with an affordable Android phone that wasn't limited to tolerable
Android 10 runs really smooth, and the device just has a nice overall physical feel to it
If you want a really good phone but don't like spending a lot, this is one of the best you will find in the $200-300 price range

This makes operation super easy, but essentially what happens is the sanitizer runs twice every time you want to sanitize your phone once (it turns when you first put your phone in, and then turns on again when you open the case to take your phone out)
This is just a design feature preference, but I trust this brand and it functions well!

After reading how cell phones are covered in bacteria and that UV-C (specifically) can kill them, I thought I would give this a try
Gimmick - Not your cheapest or most effective cleaning solution
Just clean the phone with rubbing (isopropyl) alcohol - (at least 91% but the higher % the better) One bottle costs a couple bucks at any pharmacy
I’d recommend you also grab microfiber cleaning cloths (not the fuzzy ones, the fine ones for electronics), you grand total will still be less than $10
A bottle lasts for years, and has the added benefit of cleaning all the grease off super easily
You will be able to use it on lots of differently sized devices including tablets, laptop screens, etc

I usually hold the microfiber cloth over the top of the bottle, turn bottle over to wet a couple inches of microfiber cloth, put lid back on bottle (it evaporates quickly) then use the cloth to wipe down the surface, let it evaporate
The entire process takes less than a minute
I have used it on tablets, Kindle e-readers, phones, laptop screens, monitors, etc

I Bought this for My Mom in Amazon Great Diwali Sale
Now let's talk about Device
It has a Huge 5
5 inch Display , a 2
Screen Quality Excellent
It has Samsung Exynos 7870 which is built on 14nm and it is very Effecient and power saving chip
Camera is Amazing because of 13MP Rear and 8MP Front Camera having F/1
9 Aperture lens
Fingerprint Sensor is Fast
The Important Battery Life
It has 3,300 mAH Battery
And really it last full Day but more than a Day
Battery Life is excellent because of 14nm Exynos 7870 Processor and The Charger has rating of 1
55 Ampere at 5Volts but The Charger is very Fast
It's has 3 Gigabyte of RAM which is really good
RAM Management is Excellent by Samsung
It got New Samsung Experience 8
1 UI which is also seen on Note 8 and many other
My Final Verdict
This phone is excellent at this price point though it lacks some Sensor but it is best
